intro: Leucopogon neoanglicus, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves and showy, pink to white flowers. The plant is typically found in coastal areas and moist habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators, including bees and birds. Leucopogon neoanglicus plays an important ecological role in its native environment, contributing to biodiversity and supporting local wildlife.
